tweets.text:
#StormChristoph has now reached the North West with heavy rain falling across the whole region. 

Sign up now for free flood warnings ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

#beprepared #prepareactsurvive https://t.co/gwYxiCjrYe

Here's @stewart_mounsey a Flood Risk Manager at #TeamEA with an update and advice ahead of potential flooding this week

Prepare now for #StormChristoph and sign up for flood warnings in your area here https://t.co/F1wbUHPZe8

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/4dola2dANt

‚ö†Ô∏è You can report flooding issues by calling 0345 8 506 506 or visit https://t.co/QZlev6qYSi

üöó Never drive through flood water, there may be hidden dangers underneath and please only travel if it is essential.

Follow @EnvAgencyYNE @metofficeYorks

#WakeyWinter https://t.co/kKW7aiz8CD

urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
There are a number of flood warnings in place across England, with heavy rainfall expected in the next few days.

By knowing what to do in a #flood, you can reduce the impacts to your home, family and possessions.

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY 

#StormCristoph https://t.co/FMPUiziILV

urls.title: River and sea levels in England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: #StormChristoph #flooding Follow these links for all the advice. Flood warnings - https://t.co/4xcJYriIJy River levels - https://t.co/yfKFbMLcIQ Road closures follow @northyorkscc Expect every road to have flooding & don‚Äôt drive through it! @NorthYorksFire @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/ZTzoIqYwRk

Heavy rain brings a high risk of surface water #flooding. 

Stay safe and don‚Äôt walk or drive through flood water. 

For guidance on #SurfaceWaterFlooding in your area, contact your local authority. 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/8eYE9vH9AD

Please heed the warnings & stay safe out there over the next few days. Also thoughts with all those who will be on the front line dealing with what could be some serious weather related incidents including but not exclusively the teams from @EnvAgency @ADA_updates & many others https://t.co/BCcD4Lsdtd

tweets.text:
There are a number of flood warnings in place across England, with heavy rainfall expected in the next few days.

By knowing what to do in a #flood, you can reduce the impacts to your home, family and possessions.

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY 

#StormCristoph https://t.co/FMPUiziILV

#StormChristoph will bring flooding over the next few days. So this is what you need to bookmark to #PrepareActSurvive - our flood warnings here https://t.co/K5GUW3z87V - latest river levels here https://t.co/A4ZFugPE88 & what to do in a flood https://t.co/Kze58IHzY1 Please share https://t.co/qyBs5gZHQg

‚ÄºÔ∏èIf you live near a flood hotspot that flood regularly please ensure you take the nessasary steps to be #floodaware and plan ahead. ‚û°Ô∏èSign up to @EnvAgencyMids #floodwarnings and take action.  ‚ö†Ô∏èFLOODING of communities is likely due to #stormchristoph‚ö†Ô∏è https://t.co/iKQgPjt0nC

We are expecting heavy rainfall across #Yorkshire this week. 
Get the latest flood info & sign up to receive flood warnings here: 
https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb
#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/WMqZBhzoxy

Ahead of heavy rainfall expected on Tuesday and Wednesday due to Storm Christoph, JBA's @floodforesight is forecasting the potential for flooding across northern England, coinciding with @metoffice and @EnvAgency warnings. We'll continue to monitor the event as it unfolds. https://t.co/5poKvPBnKZ

An amber weather alert for heavy rain has been issued for West Yorkshire. Please:

üîî Sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/4U4dkBdzBo 

üõ£Ô∏è Report blocked drains to us: https://t.co/SvPz6XcFYG

üìù Be prepared to activate your flood plan if required: https://t.co/HEOsjD3jNK. https://t.co/VBl9PhL15f

tweets.text:
And here, @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK behave like they work for the water companies they regulate - not chalk streams, wildlife and British people.

When will that change? When will licenses be revoked?

https://t.co/cfoFcEUZTn

#TeamEA are preparing for #StormChristoph 

Here @stewart_mounsey tells you what we are doing and how you can prepare yourself.  

Make sure you sign up for flood warnings here https://t.co/F1wbUI7A5G

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/eUI11Kdb6l

''The situation is very volatile and so it's particularly important that people play close attention to flood warnings.''

tweets.text: Devastating report confirms the dreadful state of the Cam and its chalk stream tributaries but water companies and @EnvAgency escape blame. (Not surprisingly given Cambridge Water co-commissioned it) @CamLabEF   @greenarteries  @CPRECambs @Feargal_Sharkey  https://t.co/tbBkUTPpnN

Get prepared... a month's worth of rain is forecast in Hull over the next few days and we all know how devastating flooding is. Keep up to date on @RadioHumberside and check out @LivingWithH2O & @EnvAgencyYNE for more advice and updates
https://t.co/Z6kUUevusc

ILKLEY TOWN MEETING 10th March 5-6.30pm followed by AGM
Meeting to bring the Town together to discuss the plans for improving the water quality at Ilkley with @_RobbieMoore @markilk and invited @Alex_Ross_Shaw @YorkshireWater @EnvAgency 
Register https://t.co/jjdIu1bZ9w

Hope they got out, but possible results of driving in floodwater:

üî¥ You and your car get stuck
üî¥ Your vehicle might float away... An ambulance did once!
üî¥ The wave the driving causes can flood properties
üî¥ Your engine won't thank you

Don't take the risk! https://t.co/e3x8RQWG8P

urls.title: Successful first year for waste crime taskforce despite pandemic
urls.description: The Joint Unit for Waste Crime celebrates its first anniversary of cracking down on criminals and gangs who commit serious and organised waste crime.

tweets.text:
#WasteCrime harms our environment, community and economy.
 
We joined forces with partners to form the Joint Unit for Waste Crime, to share intelligence and work in innovative ways to disrupt waste criminals. 
 
Here's what we've achieved after 1 year üëá
https://t.co/sYwoOeE6Xu https://t.co/dKen8cb5Py

@EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency As expected, it is not 'quicker all round'. I just sat on hold for ages before giving up. Nor is this an 'incident'. The trap is regularly cleaned according to the local authorities. Only it hasn‚Äôt been, and is overflowing into the reservoir. Please fix.

tweets.text: Monksleaze was closed early this morning, the Sowy has returned to its normal winter level. We will be allowing the KSD level to fall substantially overnight to allow for some new flow monitoring equipment to be installed before the next band of rain comes in. #KSD  @EnvAgencySW

urls.title: River levels remain exceptionally high across England
